description: Retrieves the resource capacity settings for a fleet location. The data returned includes the current capacity (number of EC2 instances) and some scaling settings for the requested fleet location. For a managed container fleet, this operation also returns counts for game server container groups. Use this operation to retrieve capacity information for a fleet's remote location or home Region (you can also retrieve home Region capacity by calling DescribeFleetCapacity). To retrieve capacity data, identify a fleet and location. If successful, a FleetCapacity object is returned for the requested fleet location. Setting up Amazon GameLift fleets. Amazon GameLift service locations for managed hosting. GameLift metrics for fleets.

parameters.name: FleetId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the fleet to request location capacity for. You can use either the fleet ID or ARN value.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The fleet location to retrieve capacity information for. Specify a location in the form of an Amazon Web Services Region code, such as us-west-2.

nested_items.name: FleetCapacity
nested_items.description: Resource capacity information for the requested fleet location. Capacity objects are returned only for fleets and locations that currently exist. Changes in desired instance value can take up to 1 minute to be reflected.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the fleet associated with the location.

nested_items.name: FleetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name ( ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift fleet resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. Format is arn:aws:gamelift:<region>::fleet/fleet-a1234567-b8c9-0d1e-2fa3-b45c6d7e8912.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 instance type that is used for instances in a fleet. Instance type determines the computing resources in use, including CPU, memory, storage, and networking capacity. See Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud Instance Types for detailed descriptions.

nested_items.name: InstanceCounts
nested_items.description: The current number of instances in the fleet, listed by instance status. Counts for pending and terminating instances might be non-zero if the fleet is adjusting to a scaling event or if access to resources is temporarily affected.

nested_items.name: DESIRED
nested_items.description: Requested number of active instances. Amazon GameLift takes action as needed to maintain the desired number of instances. Capacity is scaled up or down by changing the desired instances. A change in the desired instances value can take up to 1 minute to be reflected when viewing a fleet's capacity settings.

nested_items.name: MINIMUM
nested_items.description: The minimum instance count value allowed.

nested_items.name: MAXIMUM
nested_items.description: The maximum instance count value allowed.

nested_items.name: PENDING
nested_items.description: Number of instances that are starting but not yet active.

nested_items.name: ACTIVE
nested_items.description: Actual number of instances that are ready to host game sessions.

nested_items.name: IDLE
nested_items.description: Number of active instances that are not currently hosting a game session.

nested_items.name: TERMINATING
nested_items.description: Number of instances that are no longer active but haven't yet been terminated.

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The fleet location for the instance count information, expressed as an Amazon Web Services Region code, such as us-west-2.

nested_items.name: GameServerContainerGroupCounts
nested_items.description: The number and status of game server container groups deployed in a container fleet.

nested_items.name: PENDING
nested_items.description: The number of container groups that are starting up but haven't yet registered.

nested_items.name: ACTIVE
nested_items.description: The number of container groups that have active game sessions.

nested_items.name: IDLE
nested_items.description: The number of container groups that have no active game sessions.

nested_items.name: TERMINATING
nested_items.description: The number of container groups that are in the process of shutting down.
